lead_paragraph: To many residents in Sinaloa, where Joaquín Guzmán Loera was captured, he was and remains El Señor (the Lord), a mythical figure who inspires as much respect as fear.

byline.original: By PAULINA VILLEGAS and ALBERTO ARCE

snippet: To many residents in Sinaloa, where Joaquín Guzmán Loera was captured, he was and remains El Señor (the Lord), a mythical figure who inspires as much respect as fear.

headline.main: An Uncertain New Chapter in Sinaloa, Home State of ‘El Chapo’
headline.print_headline: Uncertain Time for Residents of El Chapo’s Home State

abstract: Residents in Sinaloa, Mexico are dismayed by report that drug kingpin Joaquin Guzman Loera, who hails from area, was recaptured by Mexican marines; criminal enterprise is de facto government for inhabitants of impoverished state, building infrastructure and providing public services, employment and stability.
